body:
@lapphe - trying to diagnose (since I can confirm all checks pass on our datasets).
1) can you confirm that these are unique bodyparts:
```
'top_left_corner',
                      'top_right_corner',
                      'bottom_left_corner',
                      'bottom_right_corner',
                      'arena_center'
```

2) and any thoughts on why the RMSE error is much larger for `top_right_corner`?
```
bottom_left_corner      4.595539
bottom_right_corner     3.862469
btwn_eyes               2.259980
left_ear                2.025444
left_side               2.670598
nose                    2.060202
right_ear               2.135587
right_side              3.050381
tail_base               1.819731
top_head                2.077275
top_left_corner         3.540295
top_right_corner       12.498169
```
Is your maDLC project new or was it created prior to DLC2.2 with cropped training images?

1. Yes, those are the unique bodyparts. 
2.  I checked my labels again and the top-right_corner was mislabeled in one for the frames. After correcting that label, RMSE error went down to 5.55 for that point. I still get the same error
3. @jeylau this is a new maDLC project created with DLC 2.2
thanks @lapphe jsut to confirm, do you have folders in labeled-data that say "cropped" or no?

Hello! 
Another Windows 10 User with exactly the same problem here! 
Created a new ma project in DLC 2.2 and can't evaluate network due to the same reasons. 
There's no folder in labeled-data having "cropped" in its name.
can you both `import numpy` and run `numpy.__version__` ?
can you run `pip install --upgrade numpy` and see if that changes it?

rename.from: ValueError during network evaluation with maDLC projects
rename.to: `ValueError: all input arrays must have the same shape` during `Selecting best skeleton...`

body:
Installing numpy 1.21.2 leads to compatibility issues with tensorflow 2.6.0. 
But even after successfully upgrading numpy it still throws the same error.
can you run our testscript and confirm this works for you:  https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/recipes/installTips.html#how-to-use-the-latest-updates-directly-from-github

Sure! 
I ran the `testscript_multianimal.py` yesterday as well with numpy 1.19.5 where it passed all tests. 
Also getting `ALL DONE!!! - default multianimal cases are functional.` back when testing with numpy 1.21.2
okay; so seems a project difference to our tests; do you also have unique body parts *not just multianimalbodyparts
Yes, that's right. I have 2 unique body parts.
thanks! okay that helps me narrow it down a bit to what might be the issue - we * @jeylau ;) will get back to you next - bon weekend!
